BR_text.BRdescription:
There is a problem with how Nginx is configured to do with regards to SSI or redirects. This is visible if you click a photo to view it and then refresh the page.
 In the browser, redirections are seen with some messages: an error occurred while processing the directive.
 On the server side you will see logs like this:
 <denchmark-code>[error] 39#39: *102551 subrequests cycle while processing "/photo/extra_head.html" while sending to client, client: 172.18.0.1, server: , request: "GET /photo/f3931ae6-38c9-4d2b-a91e-3bf1e3fdea8c HTTP/1.1", subrequest: "/photo/extra_head.html", upstream: "http://127.0.0.1:3000/photo/extra_head.html", host: "localhost:8888"
 </denchmark-code>

comments_0.comment_text: I disabled Nginx SSI in dev mode as it was interfering with Webpack's hot reloading. I think it's OK that extra head and body content only appears in production mode.
